intro: Artanthe xestophylla var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf artanthe, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a decorative plant in arid landscapes. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and low-maintenance gardens.
